description.narrative: In 2008, the SDC approved the Global Programme Climate Change (GPCC), which included the strengthening of regional approaches and south-south collaboration. It further emphasizes on the synergies between political, multilateral and operational layers. The present proposal on an ASEANSwiss Partnership on Social Forestry and Climate Change fits very well the GPCC strategy. EDA has appointed an Ambassador to ASEAN and also started to assess collaborations with ASEAN, which highlights the growing importance given to ASEAN in Swiss foreign and economic policies. The present program is one of the first Swiss collaboration in this context. The Partnership aligns to the goal and objectives of the new "ASEAN Multi-Sectoral Framework on Climate Change: Agriculture and Forestry Towards Food Security (AFCC-FS)". The AFCC goal is to contribute to food security through sustainable, efficient and effective use of land, forest and water and aquatic resources by minimizing the risks and impacts of and the contributions to climate change. Aligned to the AFCC, two objectives have been defined for the Partnership: 1) Development of a common Social Forestry strategy to the mitigation and adaptation of climate change in ASEAN member states; 2) Socio-economic benefits derived from climate change for communities, women and vulnerable groups through their participation in the social forestry sector.

organisation.narrative: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation SDC

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
